articles.author: SILVIA STELLACCI and COLLEEN BARRY
articles.description: VATICAN CITY (AP) — Pope Francis in his traditional Christmas message on Wednesday urged “all people of all nations” to find courage during this Holy Year “to silence the sounds of arms and overcome divisions” plaguing the world, from the Middle East to Ukraine, Africa to Asia.
articles.title: Pope calls for nations to overcome divisions in Christmas address as communities celebrate worldwide

articles.author: KATIE MARIE DAVIES and DASHA LITVINOVA
articles.description: An Azerbaijani airliner with 67 people onboard crashed Wednesday near the Kazakhstani city of Aktau, killing 38 people and leaving 29 survivors, a Kazakh official said. Deputy Prime Minister Kanat Bozumbaev disclosed the figures while meeting with Azerbaijani officials, the Russian news agency Interfax reported.
articles.title: Azerbaijani airliner crashes in Kazakhstan, killing 38 with 29 survivors, officials say

articles.author: MARY CLARE JALONICK
articles.description: WASHINGTON (AP) — The fate of President-elect Donald Trump’s Cabinet is still unclear after Republican senators spent much of December carefully dodging questions about Robert F.
articles.title: Fate of Trump's Cabinet picks unclear as Republicans prepare to take power in Senate

articles.author: MIKE SCHNEIDER
articles.description: ORLANDO, Fla. (AP) — A man accused of attempting to assassinate President-elect Donald Trump in South Florida won't be tried until September 2025, a federal judge ruled this week.
articles.title: Trial of man accused in Trump assassination attempt in Florida pushed back to September

articles.author: SAM MEDNICK, TIA GOLDENBERG and FATMA KHALED
articles.description: JERUSALEM (AP) — A baby girl froze to death overnight in Gaza, while Israel and Hamas accused each other of complicating ceasefire efforts that could wind down the 14-month war.
articles.title: A baby froze to death overnight in Gaza as Israel and Hamas trade accusations of ceasefire delays

articles.author: SAM MCNEIL
articles.description: MODIIN, Israel (AP) — For more than 400 days after being critically wounded during Hamas’ Oct. 7, 2023, attack on southern Israel, Yona Brief tried to recover. But after losing both legs and enduring medically induced comas, the combat medic died in late November.
articles.title: An Israeli soldier who died 417 days after his Oct. 7 wounds has become a symbol of sacrifice

articles.author: MIKE SCHNEIDER
articles.description: As the U.S. Census Bureau gets public feedback about how it should tally people into new race and ethnicity groups, the agency has released new research reflecting how U.S.
articles.title: US census data shows how Middle Eastern and Hispanic residents differ in racial identity

articles.author: ILLIA NOVIKOV
articles.description: KYIV, Ukraine (AP) — Russia launched a massive missile and drone barrage targeting Ukraine's energy infrastructure on Wednesday, striking a thermal power plant and prompting Ukrainians to take shelter in metro stations on Christmas morning.
articles.title: Russia targets Ukrainian energy infrastructure on Christmas Day

articles.author: RIAZ KHAN and MUNIR AHMED
articles.description: PESHAWAR, Pakistan (AP) — Pakistan’s airstrikes on eastern Afghanistan killed 46 people, mostly women and children, a Taliban government official said Wednesday, raising fears of further straining relations between the two neighbors.
articles.title: Taliban say Pakistani airstrikes killed 46 people in eastern Afghanistan, mostly women and children

articles.description: NEW YORK (AP) — Blake Lively’s claims that “It Ends With Us” director and co-star Justin Baldoni unleashed a smear campaign against her have gained support from a new lawsuit that Baldoni’s former publicist filed against him.
articles.title: Blake Lively's claims that movie co-star launched smear campaign gets support in publicist's suit
